entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 1 "Hannah's Special Baby"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 1 "Hannah's Special Baby"
media:group.media:description:
Have you ever felt really sad about something? So sad that you cried? That's how Hannah felt.
"May . . . God . . . grant you what you have asked of him." 1 SAMUEL 1:17, NIV.
We serve God when we help others.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 2 "Hannah's Gift to God"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 2 "Hannah's Gift to God"
media:group.media:description:
Have you ever wondered about people who help at church? You can help too.
"For his whole life he will be given . . . to the Lord." 1 SAMUEL 1:28, NIV
We serve God when we help God's leaders.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 3 "Ears to Hear"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 3 "Ears to Hear"
media:group.media:description: When someone calls you to come, do you go quickly? Or do you move slowly, or not at all? Little Samuel heard someone calling him. What do you think he did? Speak, Lord, for your servant is listening. 1 SAMUEL 3:9, NIV. We serve God when we listen to His voice.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 4 "Samuel's Service"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 4 "Samuel's Service"
media:group.media:description:
What will you be when you grow up? Will you be a leader like Samuel?
"Samuel continued as judge . . . all the days of his life." 1 SAMUEL 7:15, NIV.
I will serve Jesus all my life.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 6 "Miracle Oil "

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 6 "Miracle Oil "
media:group.media:description:
Paige sat on the porch, ready to bite into her last cookie. Her friend Julie came running over. Uh-oh. What should Paige do?
When Elijah was hungry, someone shared with him. "He is our God and we are . . . under his care." PSALM 95:7, NIV.
God uses others to love and care for us.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 07 "The Boy Is Alive"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 07 "The Boy Is Alive"
media:group.media:description:
Do you remember ever being really, really sick? So sick that you thought you might never get well? That happened to the widow's son
"The Lord . . . cares for those who trust in him." NAHUM 1:7, NIV.
God will always answer our prayers.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 8 "Up, Up, and Away!"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 8 "Up, Up, and Away!"
media:group.media:description:
Do you want to go to heaven? What do you want to see there? What do you want to do? Elijah wanted to go, too.
"God . . . gives power and strength to his people." PSALM 68:35, NIV.
God gives us power.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 9 "Never-ending Oil"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 9 "Never-ending Oil"
media:group.media:description:
Has your family ever asked to borrow something from a neighbor? Some flour, or perhaps a tool? A poor widow once borrowed some unusual things.
"Elisha replied, . . . 'How can I help you?' " 2 KINGS 4:2, NIV.
God's people care for one another.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 10 "Alive Again"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 10 "Alive Again"
media:group.media:description:
Have you ever visited a friend's house and been given good food to eat and a comfortable place to sleep? A woman did that for Elisha.
"If one falls down, his friend can help him up." ECCLESIASTES 4:10, NIV
God's people are kind to one another.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 11 "Poison in the Pot"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 11 "Poison in the Pot"
media:group.media:description:
Do you complain about what's for supper? I hope not! But I think if you were a student at the school Elisha visited, you might have a good reason to complain about the stew.
"For I will surely show you kindness." 2 SAMUEL 9:7, NIV
God helps us see and supply others' needs.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 12 "The Floating Axhead"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 12 "The Floating Axhead"
media:group.media:description:
Do you think God knows about the tiniest ant crawling along? He does. He cares about little things. A long time ago God showed someone how much He cared about a little thing.
"Serve each other with love." GALATIANS 5:13, ICB.
We can help others, even in small ways.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 13 "Angels All Around"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year A Quarter 3 Episode 13 "Angels All Around"
media:group.media:description:
Have you ever been scared of something, like a loud thunderstorm or a big dog? Elisha's servant was afraid. But Elisha knew what to do.
"Pray for each other." JAMES 5:16, NIV.
We help others when we pray for them.

entry.title: Kindergarten Year B Quarter 3 Episode 13 "God's 10 Rules"

media:group.media:title: Kindergarten Year B Quarter 3 Episode 13 "God's 10 Rules"
media:group.media:description:
Do you have some rules in your house? Rules such as not eating between meals or putting your toys away? Rules help us. They helped the Israelites too.
"We will do everything the Lord has said." EXODUS 19:8, NIV.
We thank God for showing us how to live.
more at www.gracelink.net/kindergarten
